item.title: Fly tipping, base of tree, outside 137 Powerscroft Road, 18th February
item.description:
Fly tipping under tree by 137 Powerscroft Rd - recurring issue for months, possibly years. Bagged waste, but sometimes loose, incl. rubbish & household items. Frequently disturbed, spreading across the pavement, obstructing people passing & exiting the car

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London

item.title: A lady tripped up yesterday and cut her head and arm. This is the third person I’ve seen to fall over because of the uneven drive and pavement., 18th February
item.description:
The pavement and driveway is uneven.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chesham Avenue, Petts Wood, Greater London

item.title: Messy Messy Glenister road, 18th February
item.description:
This has been a weekly dumping spot for fly tippers. There are multiple overfilled bins and dumped waste left on the pavement. Rubbish is regularly left outside the bins, leaving the pavement unclean, unsanitary, and difficult to pass. The area is attracting animals I recently witnessed a cat eating out of the bins, which raises serious hygiene and public health concerns. In addition, screws and nails are being left scattered in the road. This has already caused a puncture to my vehicle tyre costing me a fortune to have repaired due to our MESSY ROAD this poses a clear danger to residents, pedestrians, cyclists, and other road users. The persistent state of the pavement and road is unsafe and unacceptable. I respectfully request urgent action to remove the waste, properly clean the pavement, clear the road of sharp debris, and take steps to prevent this from continuing I.e installing a camera to capture those that consistently disrespect our community and compromise the safety of residents. Please confirm what measures will be put in place to resolve this ongoing problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenister Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light Nuisance, 18th February
item.description:
The street lamp (number 9) in White Oak Gardens, as indicated on the map, shines into our bedroom (1 Acacia Way) at night so is affecting our sleep. Could a light shield be fitted to stop the light shining into the property. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, White Oak Gardens, Blackfen, Greater London
